frame.name: Subjective_influence
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen>, <fen>Situation</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen> has an influence on a <fen>Cognizer</fen>. The influence may be general; or it may be manifested in the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s engaging in an <fen>Action</fen> as a consequence of the influence; or the <fen>Cognizer</fen> may be influenced in how they carry out a <fen>Behavior</fen> that they are engaged in already. Alternatively, a <fen>Product</fen> may be specified whose production or design was influenced by the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s experience of the <fen>Situation</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen>. <ex></ex>
The mediation of the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s psyche distinguishes this frame from the Objective_influence frame, where dependent events occur automatically given the appropriate kind of influencing force. In this frame, by contrast, a <fen>Cognizer</fen> may perceive an influence yet not respond to it in any way.
<ex> <fex name="ent">These works</fex> had a profound effect and <t>influenced</t> <fex name="cog">her</fex> <fex name="beh">in the creation of a successful series capturing this sun-drenched region</fex>.</ex> <ex>I'm sure if I asked Mattel <fex name="sit">what</fex> <t>inspired</t> <fex name="pro">this car</fex> I would be told it's an original design, and not supposed to represent any actual car.</ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Cognizer
FE.definition:
<def-root>The person who is influenced by the <fen>Situation</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>George Gilder would run with this idea later in writing the New Testament of supply-side economics that <t>influenced</t> <fex name="cog">Reagan</fex>. </ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Situation
FE.definition:
<def-root>A state of affairs--- which can be an event, state or conditions---that has an influence on the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
<ex><fex name="sit">The balmy temperatures</fex> <t>inspired</t> me to write a poem on the advent of spring.</ex> <ex>Hecker said that although <fex name="sit">the sheer age of the building</fex> <t>inspired</t> him to preserve its heritage aspects he also designed its interiors around the ·clean and fresh· mood of Queensland.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition:
<def-root>A person or thing that has an influence on the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
<ex><fex name="ent">The painting</fex> <t>inspired</t> me to take a risk and use the intense green for the sky.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Action
FE.definition:
<def-root>An Action that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> decides to carry out as a consequence of the influence of a <fen>Situation</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>What factors <t>influenced</t> Nixon <fex name="act">to issue the doctrine</fex>?</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Behavior
FE.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Behavior</fen> that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is engaged in independently but whose execution is subsequently influenced by the <fen>Situation</fen> or <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>Attention will also be paid to St. Paul , what <t>influenced</t> him <fex name="beh">in his thinking</fex> and what he wrote in his letters about sex, sexuality, men and women</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Product
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity that stands metonymically for the actions and considerations that produced it.
<ex>Does anyone know what <t>inspired</t> <fex name="pro">this song</fex>? </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> at which the Subjective_influencing event occurs.</def-root>

FE.name: Event_description
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE applies to appraisals of the Subjective_influence event. </def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition:
<def-root>The location in which one has influence.
<ex><fex name="Entity">Chavez</fex> has much influence <fex name="Place">in South America</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition:
<def-root>The field in which one maintains influence.
<ex><fex name="Entity">Chavez</fex> has much influence <fex name="dom">in South American politics</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>This is typically an adjective describing a nominal target.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: impact.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: have a strong effect

lexUnit.name: influential.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: having great influence

lexUnit.name: inspire.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: fill with the urge or ability to do or feel something.

lexUnit.name: influence.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to have an emotional effect on

lexUnit.name: influence.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an effect on the character or behaviour of someone or something, or the capacity to produce such effects

lexUnit.name: inspiration.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an event of sudden creativity

lexUnit.name: effect.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an emotional impact

lexUnit.name: impact.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a marked emotional effect

lexUnit.name: drive.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: compel to act in a particular way

lexUnit.name: motivate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: stimulate the interest of.

lexUnit.name: push.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: motivate or drive

lexUnit.name: galvanize.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: stir, excite, possible to action.

lexUnit.name: coax.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: attempt to influence (someone) by gentle persuasion or flattery

lexUnit.name: entice.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: attract by offering pleasure or advantage.

lexUnit.name: spur.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: encourage, incite or urge on

lexUnit.name: tempt.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: entice (someone) to do something against their better judgement.

lexUnit.name: discourage.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to dissuade (usually followed by 'from'), and/or to deprive of confidence; dishearten

lexUnit.name: encourage.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to inspire with confidence, spirit or hope

lexUnit.name: goad.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to encourage, drive, incite

lexUnit.name: stimulate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to rouse to action or effort through encouragement or pressure
